title: Bug 3622: New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: The New Package Wizard has a confusing message displayed at the top when the package name field is empty. The user is prompted with the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message is unclear and raises questions for the user. The bug report includes a conversation log where it is mentioned that there should be no error message when the package name field is empty and the finish button should be disabled. It is also mentioned that the message is a warning and it will be removed. The user also mentions an issue regarding the creation of a default package.
OB: When the package name field is empty in the New Package Wizard, a message is displayed at the top saying 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'
EB: When the package name field is empty in the New Package Wizard, there should be no message displayed at the top
SR:
1. Open the New Package Wizard
2. Leave the package name field empty
3. Verify that no message is displayed at the top of the wizard
